title: Classic Tiramisu
description: The iconic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cream.

instructions.text: Beat egg yolks and sugar until pale and thick. Add a splash of coffee liqueur or vanilla if desired.
Fold in mascarpone cheese until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks. Fold into mascarpone mixture.
Dip ladyfingers one by one into the coffee and arrange in a single layer in a 9x13 dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers. Repeat with a second layer.
Dust generously with cocoa powder. Refrigerate for at least 6 hours, preferably overnight.

title: Apple Crumble
description: A warm and comforting dessert with tender apples and a crisp, buttery topping.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Toss apple slices with lemon juice, granulated sugar, cinnamon, and a tablespoon of flour.
Spread apples in a 9-inch square baking dish.
In a bowl, mix remaining flour, brown sugar, and oats.
Cut in cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle crumb mixture evenly over apples. Bake for 35-40 minutes until topping is golden and filling is bubbling.
Serve warm, optionally with vanilla ice cream.

title: Crème Brûlée
description: A classic French dessert with a rich custard base topped with a layer of caramelized sugar.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Heat cream with vanilla bean (split and scraped) or extract until hot but not boiling.
Whisk egg yolks and sugar until pale. Gradually whisk in hot cream.
Strain mixture and divide among six ramekins. Place in a baking dish and add hot water to halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
Bake for 35-40 minutes until centers are barely set. Chill for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Before serving, sprinkle each with a thin layer of sugar. Caramelize with a kitchen torch or under a broiler.

title: New York Cheesecake
description: A rich, dense and creamy classic American dessert with a graham cracker crust.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
Beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla and sour cream.
Pour batter over crust. Place pan in a water bath by wrapping outside with foil and placing in a larger pan with hot water.
Bake for 60-70 minutes until center is almost set. Turn off oven, crack door slightly, and let cheesecake cool in oven for 1 hour.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight. Run a knife around the edge before removing rim.
Optional: Top with fresh berries, fruit compote, or chocolate sauce.

title: Chocolate Mousse
description: A light and airy chocolate dessert that's both elegant and simple.

instructions.text: Melt chocolate and butter together in a heatproof bowl set over simmering water. Let cool slightly.
In a separate bowl, whisk egg yolks and sugar until pale and thick.
Fold the chocolate mixture into the egg mixture.
In another bowl, whip heavy cream and vanilla to soft peaks.
Gently fold whipped cream into chocolate mixture in two batches.
Divide mousse among serving glasses. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
